evidence.text:
Person B: Can, Brightbill...?
Person A: Endurance. Keep him in the air. All day. First light to dusk, his feet cannot touch the ground. Understand?
Person B: I understand.
Person A: Brightbill was never supposed to get this far, you know that. It is more dangerous for him than anyone else. But he has a chance, if where his wings end, his heart can pay the balance.

Person B: Attention everyone. The time has come again. This flight is thousands of unforgiving miles. It has shaped us, and tested us over millennia. Now, join your families. And good luck.
Person B: Ah hah! There you are. Right on time. Hello, Brightbill.
Person B: Good-bye Roz. I am honored to have met you. You are a credit to whatever species it is you belong to.
